DIPHTHERIA WITH PERTUSSIS, POLIOMYELITIS VACCINE AND TETANUS

VACCINES

  • Indications and doses
  • Pregnancy
  • Side effects
  • Prescribing and dispensing
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

First booster dose,

By intramuscular injection

  • For children 3–10 years
    0.5 mL, to be given 3 years after primary immunisation.

Vaccination of pregnant women against pertussis,

By intramuscular injection

  • For adults females of childbearing potential
    0.5 mL for 1 dose.

Advice when patient is pregnant

Contra-indicated in pregnant women with a history of encephalopathy of unknown origin within 7 days of previous immunisation with a pertussis-containing vaccine.

Contra-indicated in pregnant women with a history of transient thrombocytopenia or neurological complications following previous immunisation against diphtheria or tetanus.

Known side effects

General side effects

notKnown: Restlessness, sleep disturbances, unusual crying in infants,

Side effects of vaccines containing pertussis

The incidence of local and systemic effects is generally lower with vaccines containing acellular pertussis components than with the whole-cell pertussis vaccine used previously. However, compared with primary vaccination, booster doses with vaccines containing acellular pertussis are reported to increase the risk of injection-site reactions (some of which affect the entire limb); local reactions do not contra-indicate further doses.

The vaccine should not be withheld from children with a history to a preceding dose of:

  • fever, irrespective of severity;
  • persistent crying or screaming for more than 3 hours;
  • severe local reaction, irrespective of extent.

Information regarding prescribing and dispensing

Available as part of childhood immunisation schedule from health organisations or ImmForm.

Available for vaccination of pregnant women from ImmForm.

Prepared medicinal forms of DIPHTHERIA WITH PERTUSSIS, POLIOMYELITIS VACCINE AND TETANUS

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Suspension for injection
